articles.author: CBC News
articles.title: Tiny and unregulated, ultrafine particles have the potential to cause major health problems
articles.description: A thousand times thinner than a strand of hair, ultrafine particles are emitted by vehicles and industrial activity — and according to a recent study led by researchers at McGill University, contribute to more than 1,000 premature deaths a year in Montreal an…
articles.content:
When we talk about air pollution, most of us probably think about smog or the smoke associated with wildfires.
But scientists are learning more about a category of pollutants that are smaller in sta… [+758 chars]
